intro: Dianthus kuschakewiczii, commonly known as the Kuschakewicz's carnation, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer, and it is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
